brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to investigate the placebo effect in a smartphone-based training, ostensibly designed to improve mood and perceived stress by daily exposition to either mock sound or color.

detailed_description.textblock: The overall goal of the outlined study is to investigate the placebo effect in a smartphone-based training, ostensibly designed to improve mood and perceived stress by daily exposition to either mock sound or color. During 14 days, subjects will participate in regular daily training sessions. During another 6 days, subjects will transfer the smartphone-based training to daily life.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in mood (Assessed via Multidimensional Mood State Questionnaire)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre- and post-training, during 20 days of training
primary_outcome.description: Assessed via Multidimensional Mood State Questionnaire

primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre- and post-training, during 20 days of training
primary_outcome.description: Assessed via State-Trait-Anxiety Inventory; Visual Analog Scale

secondary_outcome.description: Assessed via Self-Assessment-Manikin scales after exposition to affective pictures taken from International Affective Picture System

other_outcome.measure: Efficacy expectancy (Assessed via Credibility Expectancy Questionnaire)
Feedback on adverse events during the daily training session (Number of subjects reporting an adverse event)
other_outcome.description: Number of subjects reporting an adverse event

arm_group.description: No expectancy instruction with regard to the efficacy of the daily smartphone-based training
Prospective expectancy instruction ("Training will have an effect on...") with regard to the efficacy of the daily smartphone-based training
Retrospective expectancy instruction ("Training already had an effect on...") with regard to the efficacy of the daily smartphone-based training
Prospective ("Training will have an effect on...") and retrospective ("Training already had an effect on...") expectancy instruction with regard to the efficacy of the daily smartphone-based training

intervention.description: No expectancy instruction with regard to the efficacy of the daily smartphone-based training (exposition to either mock sound or color)
Prospective expectancy instruction ("Training will have an effect on...") with regard to the efficacy of the daily smartphone-based training (exposition to either mock sound or color)
Retrospective expectancy instruction ("Training already had an effect on...") with regard to the efficacy of the daily smartphone-based training (exposition to either mock sound or color)

Prospective ("Training will have an effect on...") and retrospective ("Training already had an effect on...") expectancy instruction with regard to the efficacy of the daily smartphone-based training (exposition to either mock sound or color)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Access to smartphone during study period
Exclusion Criteria:
- Severe visual impairment
- Dyschromatopsia
- Severe defective hearing
- Regular intake of medication (excl. contraceptives)
- Severe mental disorders
